means: 嗅，闻( smell的第三人称单数 )

sentence.Network_en: This shampoo smells fruity and leaves the hair beautifully silky.
sentence.Network_cn: 这款洗发水是果香型的，洗后头发如丝般顺滑。

sentence.Network_en: The smells of delicious foods floated all around him.
sentence.Network_cn: 美食的香味弥漫在他的四周。

sentence.Network_en: Try to locate exactly where the smells are entering the room.
sentence.Network_cn: 找找看气味具体是从什么地方散入房间的。

PerfectNetExp.abs: This fish smells ., 这鱼发臭了.
The room smells of stale air . It must have been vacant for along time ., 这个房间有股霉味 , 一定是很久没人住了.
your body smells , you should take a shower ., 你的身体发出臭味 , 应去洗个澡.
she is sensitive to strong smells ., 她对强烈的气味很敏感.

list.abs: 异味(Peculiar smell)、瘙痒——恐怕是真菌性阴道炎或阴道(Vaginal)滴虫病。在禁锢之前，你是自由的； 要是在孕珠时候患上了真菌 …
smell prism 嗅觉棱柱体smell receptor 嗅觉感受器smell threshold 嗅觉阈限
大学英语四级常用词组 ... smell about 到处嗅寻；到处找 smell of 有…的气味 smell out 嗅出，凭嗅觉发现….
大学英语四级常用词组 ... smell of 有…的气味 smell out 嗅出，凭嗅觉发现… smile on 对…赞许.
『自考』综合英语(二)上册短语总结 ... figure out 搞清楚，想清楚 smell out 察觉 count out 数出.

entry.def: The smell of something is a quality it has which you become aware of when you breathe in through your nose.

example.tran: 新鲜出炉的面包的香味

entry.def: Your sense of smell is the ability that your nose has to detect things.

example.ex: ...people who lose their sense of smell.

entry.def: If something smells in a particular way, it has a quality which you become aware of through your nose.

example.tran: 房间里有股柠檬的味道。

entry.def: If you say that something smells, you mean that it smells unpleasant.

example.ex: Ma threw that out. She said it smelled...
example.tran: 妈把那玩意扔出去了，她说它有股怪味。

entry.def: If you smell something, you become aware of it when you breathe in through your nose.

example.ex: As soon as we opened the front door we could smell the gas.
example.tran: 我们一打开前门，就闻到了煤气的味道。

entry.def: If you smell something, you put your nose near it and breathe in, so that you can discover its smell.

example.ex: I took a fresh rose out of the vase on our table, and smelled it.
example.tran: 我从饭桌上的花瓶里抽了一只新鲜的玫瑰，闻了闻。

entry.def: If you smell something, you feel that it is likely to happen or be true.

example.ex: He knew virtually nothing about music but he could smell a hit.
example.tran: 他对音乐几乎一窍不通，却预感到它将会大受欢迎。

auth_sentence.content: The odor smells like motor oil mixed with fuel.
